data.text: Hear therefore, O ye kings, and understand;
Give ear, ye that rule the people,
For power is given you of the Lord,
Because, being ministers of his kingdom, ye have not judged aright,
Horribly and speedily shall he come upon you:
For mercy will soon pardon the meanest:
For he which is Lord over all shall fear no manâ€™s person,
But a sore trial shall come upon the mighty.
Unto you therefore, O kings, do I speak,
For they that keep holiness holily shall be judged holy:
Wherefore set your affection upon my words;
Wisdom is glorious, and never fadeth away:
She preventeth them that desire her,
Whoso seeketh her early shall have no great travail:
To think therefore upon her is the perfection of wisdom:
For she goeth about seeking such as are worthy of her,
For the very true beginning of her is the desire of discipline;
And love is the keeping of her laws;
And incorruption maketh us near unto God:
Therefore the desire of wisdom bringeth to a kingdom.
If your delight be then in thrones and scepters, O ye kings of the people,
As for wisdom, what she is, and how she came up, I will tell you,
Neither will I go with consuming envy;
But the multitude of the wise is the welfare of the world:
Receive therefore instruction through my words,
